name: The Inkling Society: Texas A&M English Society
description:
We meet every Wednesday at 7:00pm on campus in the MSC room 2504!*
*Unless otherwise noted.


September 7th - December 7th

In 1984, The English Club was founded with a mission to connect reading and writing enthusiasts through social activities and interaction between student members and the Administration and Faculty of the English Department. It has gone through some name changes, the English Language and Literature Society and now the Inkling Society, but the group still continues to build a community for lovers of literature and creative writing.

Primary Activities:
-Discussing the selected novel for the semester and our favorite literature
-Creative Writing exercises
-Critiquing fellow students writing
-Movie Screenings
-Game nights, socials, themed parties
-Promoting a love of literature throughout the community

Connect with other reading and writing enthusiasts! Whether you're a reader or perhaps a future author--The Inkling Society is for you!

President: Kaylin Krienke

Vice President: Nichole Mehlhaff

Secretary: Taylor Doraty

Treasurer: Joshua Stenzel

Public Relations Officer: Kennan McMillan



Find us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/InklingSocietyTAMU/

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/TAMUInkling

Website: http://inklingstamu.weebly.com/

Contact Us: Inkling.officers@gmail.com   OR    Kkrienke@tamu.edu
summary: Founded in 1984 and originally known as The English Club, The Inkling Society's mission is to connect reading and writing enthusiasts through weekly meeting, themed socials, and member participation in literature discussion and creative writing critiques.
